person.persName: John Russell Bartlett (Providence, Rhode Island, cashier, merchant, United States Commissioner, and Secretary of State of Rhode Island)

body.p: Providence, Providence County, Rhode Island, cashier, merchant, United States Commissioner, and Secretary of State of Rhode Island. Providence, Providence County, Rhode Island, native. Son of Smith Bartlett and Nancy Russell Bartlett. Married to Eliza Allen Rhodes in Rhode Island on May 15, 1831. Father of Elizabeth Dorrance Bartlett, Anna Russell Bartlett, Henry Anthony Bartlett, George Francis Bartlett, John Russell Bartlett, Leila Bartlett, and Fanny Osgood Bartlett. Married to Ellen Eddy Bartlett in New York City, New York County, New York, on November 12, 1863. Cashier of the Globe Bank in Providence from 1831 to 1837. Merchant in New York City from 1837 to 1849. Resident of Kent County, Rhode Island, in 1850. United States Commissioner from 1850 to 1853. Secretary of State of Rhode Island from 1855 until 1872. Resident of Providence in 1860.
